required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Mobile Health Exercise Intervention for Older Patients With Myeloid Neoplasms (GO- EXCAP) Mobile App
clinical_study.official_title: A Mobile Health Exercise Intervention for Older Patients With Myeloid Neoplasms

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study to evaluate the feasibility of a mobile health exercise intervention (GO-EXCAP Mobile App) over 7 weeks in 25 patients with myeloid neoplasms receiving hypomethylating agents.

detailed_description.textblock: Up to 98% of older patients with myeloid neoplasms experience physical function decline, fatigue, and mood disturbances. Mobile health exercise interventions are promising strategy to prevent physical function decline and improve fatigue and mood disturbances, but older patients with myeloid neoplasms receiving hypomethylating agents are understudied. The proposed study will evaluate a novel mobile health exercise intervention that is adapted to older patients with myeloid neoplasms receiving outpatient hypomethylating agents and investigate whether and how exercise can prevent physical function decline, improve fatigue and mood disturbances, and prevent worsening quality of life.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Evaluating the feasibility of a mobile health exercise intervention in older adults with myeloid neoplasms

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Percentage of patients wearing the activity tracker and entering resistance exercise data
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients wearing the activity tracker and entering resistance exercise data into the mobile app.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Percentage of patients performing both walking and resistance exercises during the study
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients performing both walking and resistance exercises during the study period days.
Recruitment rates (percentage of patients who are approached and agree to enroll).
Retention rates (percentage of patients who are enrolled and complete post-intervention assessments)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post changes in the following outcomes:
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in physical function measured using the Short Physical Performance Battery (SPPB) which an objective physical assessment evaluating lower extremity physical function (score ranges from 0-12; higher score indicates better physical function). It is comprised of 3 components: a four-meter walk, repeated chair stands and a balance test (the score for each component ranges from 0-4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post changes in the following outcomes:
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in fatigue measures using the Brief Fatigue Inventory (BFI) which is a 9-item, patient-reported instrument. The score for each item ranges from 0-10, a higher score indicates higher self-reported levels of fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post changes in the following outcomes:
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in depression measured using the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) which is a 20-item depression scale. The score for each item ranges from 0-3, a higher score indicates higher self-reported depression levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post changes in the following outcomes:
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in quality of life measured using the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Leukemia (FACT-Leu) scale. It consists of 44 items divided into 5 subscales: physical well-being (PWB), social well-being (SWB), emotional well-being (EWB), functional well-being (FWB) and leukemia-specific concerns. The score for each item ranges from 0-4. After reversing the scoring of negatively worded items, all the scores are summated. A higher score indicates better quality of life.

arm_group.description: GO-EXCAP Mobile App involves the use of a mobile app delivery platform to deliver an exercise program [Exercise for Cancer Patients (EXCAP©®)]. EXCAP©® is a progressive walking and resistance exercise program

intervention.description: A mobile app delivery platform and the EXCAP©® exercise program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age greater than 60 years
- Have a diagnosis of myeloid neoplasms
- Receiving hypomethylating agents
- English speaking
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2
- No medical contraindications for exercise per oncologist
- Able to walk 4 meters as part of Short Physical Performance Battery measured walk (with or without assistive device)
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria: None
-

results_reference.citation: Loh KP, Kleckner IR, Lin PJ, Mohile SG, Canin BE, Flannery MA, Fung C, Dunne RF, Bautista J, Culakova E, Kleckner AS, Peppone LJ, Janelsins M, McHugh C, Conlin A, Cho JK, Kasbari S, Esparaz BT, Kuebler JP, Mustian KM. Effects of a Home-based Exercise Program on Anxiety and Mood Disturbances in Older Adults with Cancer Receiving Chemotherapy. J Am Geriatr Soc. 2019 May;67(5):1005-1011. doi: 10.1111/jgs.15951.

Loh KP, Ramsdale E, Culakova E, Mendler JH, Liesveld JL, O'Dwyer KM, McHugh C, Gilles M, Lloyd T, Goodman M, Klepin HD, Mustian KM, Schnall R, Mohile SG. Novel mHealth App to Deliver Geriatric Assessment-Driven Interventions for Older Adults With Cancer: Pilot Feasibility and Usability Study. JMIR Cancer. 2018 Oct 29;4(2):e10296. doi: 10.2196/10296.

patient_data.ipd_description: A complete and final study protocol will be made publicly available through the University of Rochester Cancer Center Community Oncology Research Program Research Base Protocol and Data Sharing Committee. The full protocol and data will be made publicly available no later than the publication date of the study findings from the final dataset. The protocol will include a detailed description of the study population, hypotheses tested, measurement and assessment information, data definitions and codes, and the analysis plan utilized. We will also make this protocol available to NIH and NCI at the time of submission of each progress report and at the end of the final funding year. We will be collecting identifying information. The final dataset will be stripped of identifiers prior to release for sharing.Published papers will be made available in portable document format.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data will be available for 2-3 years from accrual of the first subject.
